intro: Epigeneium, commonly known as a type of climbing plant, belongs to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its unique growth habit, where the stems climb or trail along the ground. The leaves are typically arrow-shaped and have a glossy surface. Epigeneium plants often produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are surrounded by a spathe. These plants are commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
